Disease.content:

Paragraph: Thus , the precipitating cause of convulsions was believed to be an overdose of TNA .

2. TNA (Tryptophan-Niacin-Amino Acid): A substance that can cause an overdose, which is believed to be the precipitating cause of convulsions in the paragraph.

1. TNA (tetanus toxoid) - a chemical substance used to prevent tetanus infections.

Therefore, the only chemical entity mentioned in the paragraph is TNA.
